title: Global Thermostat unveils design with top engineering firms for a Direct Air Capture system that can scale to capture ... - PR Newswire
summary: Global Thermostat has developed a new Direct Air Capture module design, the M-Series. The M-Series module is larger and more efficient than previous designs, and it can be scaled up to remove millions of tonnes of CO2 from the atmosphere per year. This technology is a significant advancement in the fight against climate change, as it provides a way to remove CO2 from the atmosphere and store it permanently.

title: The top 20 agtech deals of 2023 - AgFunderNews
summary: Agtech and climate-focused deals made up a large portion of 2023 venture capital funding for the agricultural sector. EcoCeres, Atlas Agro, and Xpansiv were some of the top startups in the space, raising $400 million, $325 million, and $125 million, respectively. Despite fewer mega-rounds, investors are still pouring money into innovative solutions in agriculture.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article mentions several companies developing green innovations, such as EcoCeres, which converts low-value waste into high-value biofuels and biopolymers, and Charm Industrial, which converts agricultural biomass into carbon-rich liquid to remove carbon from the atmosphere.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article mentions several companies developing business innovations, such as Silo, which provides workflow automation and fintech tools for food retailers, and Bluepha, which is developing naturally occurring biopolymers to assist downstream companies.
green_product: TRUE, the article mentions several companies developing green products, such as Loam, which produces carbon-rich soil amendments, and Greenlabs, which provides precision agriculture technology to help farmers optimize crop yields while reducing environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, the article mentions several companies developing green processes, such as SAEL, which converts agricultural waste to renewable energy, and Ecorobotix, which provides automated precision spraying robots for row crops and pastures.
product_or_process: low-value waste into high-value biofuels and biopolymers

title: Daybreak Dec. 11: Vilsack says US 'flipped the script for American agriculture' at COP meeting - Agri-Pulse
summary: 1) The U.S. and other countries at the COP28 climate summit discussed the need to ensure food production meets global nutritional needs while addressing climate change, with USDA touting its efforts in this area. 2) The UN's Food and Agriculture Organization has released a roadmap to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture and food systems, targeting methane reduction and eventual carbon neutrality. 3) The House of Representatives is considering a bill that would ensure schools can offer whole milk to children, despite recommendations to limit saturated fat intake.

title: Kingspan launches hemp-based HemKor as part of its sustainability programme - RIBA Journal
summary: Kingspan, a company that has had trust issues in the past, has launched three new hemp-based insulation products in Europe. The products, Jute Blend, Pure, and Padding, are made with at least 80% bio-based material, including hemp, and are designed to have a lower environmental impact than traditional insulation products.

title: Nexus Development Capital Adds Carbon Removal to Growing Portfolio with a $5M Investment in Maine-based ... - PR Newswire
summary: Standard Biocarbon, a Maine-based producer of biochar, has received a $5 million investment from Nexus Development Capital. Biochar is a charcoal-like material produced by heating organic matter in a low-oxygen environment, and it has the potential to capture and store carbon for thousands of years. Standard Biocarbon's plant is expected to start operations in early 2024 and will produce 16,000 cubic yards of biochar and capture 3,000 tons of carbon per year.
green_innovation: TRUE, Standard Biocarbon's biochar production process meets the criteria to be a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by capturing and storing carbon.

green_product: TRUE, Standard Biocarbon's biochar meets the criteria to be a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, Standard Biocarbon's biochar production process meets the criteria to be a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by capturing and storing carbon.

title: Tall wooden buildings have a problem. Luckily, solutions do exist - Canada's National Observer
summary: The construction industry is looking to wood as a sustainable building material to reduce emissions. However, some wood products used in taller buildings are coated with toxic chemicals that make them difficult to recycle. A researcher at McGill University says that natural alternatives to synthetic resins should be used to make wood products more recyclable.

title: Mine land remediation drives demand for Hemp Farms Australia - Business News Australia
summary: The company, Hemp Farms Australia (HFA), is a specialist in industrial hemp genetics with its own unique varieties that thrive in harsh, hot environments. HFA has teamed up with a distributor in the US where the market opportunity could be 10-12 times greater than in Australia. HFA has also embarked on a $2.5 million capital raise to assist with the expansion and beef up operations at home.
